greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangle R(i,j) by antidiagonals; column j has j-1 zeros followed by numbers congruent to 1 mod j-1.
comment: The number of occurrences of k is the number of divisors of k-1, for k>=2. Column 1 of the inverse of this infinite matrix begins with (1,-1,1,-1,2,-6,24,-120,6!,-7!,8!,-9!,...). The remaining columns are likewise expressible in terms of factorials.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 19 2002
